description.narrative: By 2020, political commitment, accountability and national capacity to plan and budget for scaling up nutrition interventions are strengthened., which contributes to Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, disadvantaged girls and boys aged 0-6 years and their families will make progress in realization of their rights to quality and inclusive health care, nutrition and early learning.

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Armenia UN Building 14 Petros Adamyan Street Yerevan 0010 Armenia

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Armenia (Survive and Thrive)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Armenia: Multi-Country Evaluation of Home-Visiting for Young Child Health and Wellbeing in ECA region: Armenia Country Case Study
Armenia 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, political commitment, accountability and national capacity to plan and budget for scaling up nutrition interventions are strengthened.

description.narrative: With intensive advocacy efforts of UNICEF, the main issues related to nutrition of children of different age groups and of pregnant/lactating women have been incorporated into a draft of the key policy document of the health sector – The Strategy on Strengthening the Health System in Armenia 2020-2025, reflecting the priority given by the Government to maternal and child nutrition, and creating a strong basis for development and implementation of targeted interventions for coming years. UNICEF and world Food Programme (WFP) established an effective platform of collaboration to join efforts in nutrition programming for school-aged children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2020

title.narrative: Amount allocated from the state budget to nutrition as a separate budget line

baseline.value: 10 mln AMD allocation from the state budget to nutrition as a separate budget line

target.value: 2020:At least 20 mln AMD in allocation to nutrition budget line

actual.value: 2019:Nutrition related budget in amount of 15 mln AMD is incorporated into general public awareness component of the health budget

title.narrative: Percentage of implemented activities stipulated in national nutrition concept

baseline.value: the national child nutrition concept is approved

target.value: 2020:concept has at least 70% rate of implementation

actual.value: 2019:priority actions have been identified and implemented
